com.jaspersoft.android.sdk.client

Class JsRestClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.jaspersoft.android.sdk.client.JsRestClient

  • public class JsRestClient
extends java.lang.Object
    The central class that provides a set of convenient methods to interact with the JasperReports Server REST API and does mapping of the returned data to object model.
    Since:
    1.0

        public void setConnectTimeout(int timeout)
        Set the underlying URLConnection's connect timeout. A timeout value of 0 specifies an infinite timeout.
        Parameters:
        timeout - the timeout value in milliseconds
        Since:
        1.5

      • getResourcesList

        public java.util.List<ResourceDescriptor> getResourcesList(java.lang.String uri,
                                                  java.lang.String query,
                                                  java.lang.Boolean recursive,
                                                  java.lang.Integer limit)
                                                    throws org.springframework.web.client.RestClientException
        Gets the list of resource descriptors for the resources available in the folder specified in the URI and matching the specified parameters.
        Parameters:
        uri - repository URI (e.g. /reports/samples/)
        query - Match only resources having the specified text in the name or description (can be null)
        recursive - Get resources recursively and not only in the specified URI. Used only when a search criteria is specified, either query or type. (can be null)
        limit - Maximum number of items returned to the client. The default is 0 (can be null), meaning no limit.
        Returns:
        the list of ResourceDescriptor values
        Throws:
        org.springframework.web.client.RestClientException - thrown by RestTemplate whenever it encounters client-side HTTP errors

      • getResourceLookups

        public ResourceLookupsList getResourceLookups(java.lang.String folderUri,
                                     java.lang.String query,
                                     java.util.List<java.lang.String> types,
                                     boolean recursive,
                                     int offset,
                                     int limit)
                                       throws org.springframework.web.client.RestClientException
        Retrieves the list of resource lookup objects for the resources contained in the given parent folder and matching the specified parameters.
        Parameters:
        folderUri - parent folder URI (e.g. /reports/samples/)
        query - Match only resources having the specified text in the name or description. (can be null)
        types - Match only resources of the given types. Multiple resource types allowed. (can be null)
        recursive - Get resources recursively
        offset - Pagination. Start index for requested page.
        limit - Pagination. Resources count per page.
        Returns:
        the ResourceLookupsList value
        Throws:
        org.springframework.web.client.RestClientException - thrown by RestTemplate whenever it encounters client-side HTTP errors

      • getResourceLookups

        public ResourceLookupsList getResourceLookups(java.lang.String folderUri,
                                     java.lang.String query,
                                     java.util.List<java.lang.String> types,
                                     java.lang.String sortBy,
                                     boolean recursive,
                                     int offset,
                                     int limit)
                                       throws org.springframework.web.client.RestClientException
        Retrieves the list of resource lookup objects for the resources contained in the given parent folder and matching the specified parameters.
        Parameters:
        folderUri - parent folder URI (e.g. /reports/samples/)
        query - Match only resources having the specified text in the name or description. (can be null)
        types - Match only resources of the given types. Multiple resource types allowed. (can be null)
        sortBy - Represents a field in the results to sort by: uri, label, description, type, creationDate, updateDate, accessTime, or popularity (based on access events). (can be null)
        recursive - Get resources recursively
        offset - Pagination. Start index for requested page.
        limit - Pagination. Resources count per page.
        Returns:
        the ResourceLookupsList value
        Throws:
        org.springframework.web.client.RestClientException - thrown by RestTemplate whenever it encounters client-side HTTP errors

      • getRootFolderData

        public FolderDataResponse getRootFolderData()

      • getReportDescriptor

        public ReportDescriptor getReportDescriptor(ResourceDescriptor resourceDescriptor,
                                   java.lang.String format)
                                     throws org.springframework.web.client.RestClientException
        Runs the report and generates the specified output. The response contains report descriptor with the ID of the saved output for downloading later with a GET request.
        Parameters:
        resourceDescriptor - resource descriptor of this report
        format - The format of the report output. Possible values: PDF, HTML, XLS, RTF, CSV, XML, JRPRINT. The Default is PDF.
        Returns:
        ReportDescriptor
        Throws:
        org.springframework.web.client.RestClientException - thrown by RestTemplate whenever it encounters client-side HTTP errors

      • getReportAttachment

        public byte[] getReportAttachment(java.lang.String uuid,
                         java.lang.String name)
                           throws org.springframework.web.client.RestClientException
        Downloads specified report attachment, once a report has been generated, and keeps it in memory as a byte array.
        Parameters:
        uuid - Universally Unique Identifier. As a side effect of storing the report output in the user session, the UUID in the URI is visible only to the currently logged in user.
        name - One of the file names specified in the report xml. If the file parameter is not specified, the service returns the report descriptor.
        Returns:
        Attachment file as byte array stored in memory.
        Throws:
        org.springframework.web.client.RestClientException - thrown by RestTemplate whenever it encounters client-side HTTP errors

      • saveReportAttachmentToFile

        public void saveReportAttachmentToFile(java.lang.String uuid,
                              java.lang.String name,
                              java.io.File file)
                                throws org.springframework.web.client.RestClientException
        Downloads specified report attachment, once a report has been generated and saves it in the specified file.
        Parameters:
        uuid - Universally Unique Identifier. As a side effect of storing the report output in the user session, the UUID in the URI is visible only to the currently logged in user.
        name - One of the file names specified in the report xml. If the file parameter is not specified, the service returns the report descriptor.
        file - The file in which the attachment will be saved.
        Throws:
        org.springframework.web.client.RestClientException - thrown by RestTemplate whenever it encounters client-side HTTP errors

      • generateReportUrl

        public java.lang.String generateReportUrl(java.lang.String reportUri,
                                 java.util.List<ReportParameter> parameters,
                                 java.lang.String format)
        Generates the fully qualified report URL to receive all pages report output in specified format.
        Parameters:
        reportUri - repository URI of the report
        parameters - list of report parameter/input control values
        format - the format of the report output. Possible values: PDF, HTML, XLS, RTF, CSV, XML.
        Returns:
        the fully qualified report URL
        Since:
        1.4

      • generateReportUrl

        public java.lang.String generateReportUrl(java.lang.String reportUri,
                                 java.util.List<ReportParameter> parameters,
                                 int page,
                                 java.lang.String format)
        Generates the fully qualified report URL according to specified parameters. The new v2/reports service allows clients to receive report output in a single request-response using this url.
        Parameters:
        reportUri - repository URI of the report
        parameters - list of report parameter/input control values
        page - a positive integer value used to output a specific page or 0 to output all pages
        format - the format of the report output. Possible values: PDF, HTML, XLS, RTF, CSV, XML.
        Returns:
        the fully qualified report URL
        Since:
        1.4

                                              java.lang.String datasourceUri,

                                                throws org.springframework.web.client.RestClientException
        Gets the resource descriptor of a query-based input control that contains query data according to specified parameters.

        uri - repository URI of the input control
        datasourceUri - repository URI of a datasource for the control
        params - parameters for the input control (can be null)
        Returns:

        Throws:
        org.springframework.web.client.RestClientException - thrown by RestTemplate whenever it encounters client-side HTTP errors

        public java.lang.String generateThumbNailUri(java.lang.String resourceUri)

        Parameters:
        resourceUri - Uri of resource
        Returns:
        {serverUrl}/rest_v2/thumbnails/{resourceUri}?defaultAllowed=false

      • generateThumbNailUri

        public java.lang.String generateThumbNailUri(java.lang.String resourceUri,
                                    boolean defaultAllowed)
        Returns thumbnail image or encoded image of the requested URI
        Parameters:
        resourceUri - Uri of resource
        defaultAllowed - If true, a placeholder thumbnail will be provided when no thumbnail is available (default: false)
        Returns:
        {serverUrl}/rest_v2/thumbnails/{resourceUri}?defaultAllowed={allowedFlag}
